note.author: admin@securityroots.com
note.text: #[Title]# Use the tree on the left to browse through the items in this project.

note.author: admin@securityroots.com
note.text:
#[Title]# Ready to try the new interface?
#[Description]# Great, click on the "New notes" tab at the bottom of the screen!

note.author: admin@securityroots.com
note.text:
#[Title]# Projects, users, advanced reporting and much more
#[Projects and users]#
In Dradis Pro you can have multiple projects at the same time. Each team member signs up and creates a user account within Dradis Pro. Later they can choose in what project they want to work on.
You can go to the *Project selection* page using the link on the top-right corner of this page.
#[Note and project templates]#
After a little while of using Dradis Pro, you will realize that you are always using certain fields in your notes and certain structure in your projects.
Inside the *Templates* module (you will have to log in as *Administrator* to see it) you can define new note templates. They will automagically appear in the @add note@ menu of the toolbar.
Learn about how to create project templates with our guide: "Creating project templates and methodologies":http://securityroots.com/dradispro/support/guides/project_templates.html
#[Testing methodologies]#
Use Templates > Methodologies to define checklists and testing methodologies that you can use in your projects. "Read more":http://blog.securityroots.com/2012/09/upcoming-in-dradis-pro-v16-checklists.html
#[The Plugin Manager]#
The *Plugin Manager* is one of the most powerful tools in Dradis Pro. It lets you customize the output produced by our plugins (e.g. Nessus, Nexpose, etc.) to fit your needs.
Do you want to use Nessus' *plugin name* field in a table in your report, but you prefer to label it *Issue*? No problem, you can define this mapping using the *Plugin Manager*. Every Nessus file you upload will be parsed and the fields will be mapped to suit your needs.
#[The Export Manager]#
The first link in our powerful reporting tool chain is the *Export Manager*. In it you can review your notes, sort and rearrange them and select a format in which to export them (and yes, we support Word 2010).
What are you waiting for? Creating your report templates has never been easier, check our "Creating Word reports with DradisReports":http://securityroots.com/dradispro/support/guides/reports_dradisreports.html guide!

note.author: admin@securityroots.com
note.text:
#[Title]# Keeping an eye on us
#[Getting in touch]#
* You can find us on Twitter: "@dradispro":http://twitter.com/dradispro (product) and "@securityroots":http://twitter.com/securityroots (company) * And this is "our blog":http://securityroots.com/blog/
If you need support, check the links provided in the *Getting Help* node on the left.

note.author: admin@securityroots.com
note.text:
#[Title]# Thanks for choosing Dradis Pro
#[Just a quick word...]#
!{float:right;}/assets/logopro_small.png!
Thanks for choosing *Dradis Professional Edition* and for the trust you are placing in us.
Dradis Pro is a growing product and we are adding more awesome features every week. Check the information in the *Keeping an eye on us* note to ensure you are always in the loop of what is going on around our products and services.
Hope you enjoy using Dradis Pro as much as we enjoy creating it! And please, let me know if you have any issues at all.
Looking forward to working with you,
Daniel
p{font-size: 80%;}. _Founder of Security Roots Ltd._ "daniel@securityroots.com":mailto:daniel@securityroots.com | "@etdsoft":http://twitter.com/etdsoft on Twitter

note.author: admin@securityroots.com
note.text:
#[Title]# Dradis Professional support
#[Description]# Dradis Professional support main communications channel is through the *Dradis Pro users list*:
"http://groups.google.com/group/dradis-pro":http://groups.google.com/group/dradis-pro
Feel free to browse the archive and post new questions. We are all happy to help.
In order to be able to post you will have to sign up by sending an empty email to:
"dradis-pro+subscribe@googlegroups.com":mailto:dradis-pro+subscribe@googlegroups.com
#[Dradis Pro Guides]# In our support site you will find a great collection of step-by-step guides that will help you to get started, for example:
* "Reporting by host, reporting by issue":http://securityroots.com/dradispro/support/guides/dradisreports_byhost.html (new in v1.7!) * "Creating Word reports with DradisReports":http://securityroots.com/dradispro/support/guides/reports_dradisreports.html * "Creating project templates and methodologies":http://securityroots.com/dradispro/support/guides/project_templates.html * "DradisReports: using custom document properties":http://securityroots.com/dradispro/support/guides/dradisreports_customproperties.html
Find out more at: "http://securityroots.com":http://securityroots.com/support/

note.author: admin@securityroots.com
note.text:
#[Title]# Dradis Community support
#[Description]# Over the last few years, a rich community of Dradis Framework users has grown around the project. Here are some resources:
* "Dradis Framework site":http://dradisframework.org * "Project blog":http://blog.dradisframework.org / "RSS feed":http://blog.dradisframework.org/feeds/posts/default?alt=rss * "@dradisfw":http://twitter.com/dradisfw on Twitter * GitHub repo and issue tracker: "http://git.io/dradis":http://git.io/dradis * "Community Forums":http://dradisframework.org/community/ * "Mailing lists":http://dradisframework.org/mailing_lists.html
You can also visit the *#dradis* IRC channel in Freenode (irc.freenode.org)

note.author: admin@securityroots.com
note.text:
#[Title]# Next steps
#[Description]# You are now in the "Project view" of Dradis, this is because in the Project Selection screen you clicked on *Use* on this project.
To go back to the Project Selection screen look for the *projects* link in the upper-right corner of the window.
Things to try next:
* Add a few clients to your Dradis * Create your first project * Browse through the administration modules (Users, templates, Plugins, etc.)
